name: src/icarus/backend/index.js
Backend
description:
Handles connection with the backend.

Responsible for establishing a WebSocket (socket.io) connection with
the backend and handling its requests.

It also instantiates {@link Replicator} instances for data and log
replication. The stateChange events from these are forwarded as:
"replicator:data:state" and "replicator:log:state".

name: constructor
description: Constructor.

name: name
description: Station name.

name: _socket
description: Current socket connection with the backend.

name: _state
description: Current socket state.

name: _log
description: Logger instance.

name: dataReplicator
description: {@link Replicator} instance for dataDB.

name: logReplicator
description: {@link Replicator} instance for logDB.

name: connect
description: Connects to backend at [url].

name: disconnect
description:
Disconnects from the backend. Stops the socket.
The replicators will keep running until a new connection makes them
connect to a different database.

name: cleanup
description: Triggers {@link Replicator#cleanup} on the data and log replicators.

name: _updateState
description: Updates the socket state.

params.name: extraData
params.description: Extra data related to the new state (error, no. of connection attempts...) to be included in logs.

name: src/icarus/backend/replicator.js
Replicator
description:
Handles replication between a local and remote PouchDB database.
Keeps track of state, uses an {@link ExponentialBackoff} to prevent
connection saturation, serving as a wrapper over PouchDB replication.

The source database is set once in the constructor and remains unchanged
and unchangeable during operation.

name: _log
description: Logger instance.

name: _state
description: Replicator status.

name: _sourceDB
description: Source database.

name: _targetDB
description: Target database.

name: _backoff
description:
ExponentialBackoff instance.
Keeps track of the replication backoff.

name: _replication
description: PouchDB replication instance/ID.

name: stop
description: Stops the replication process.

name: cleanup
description:
Stops current replication and attempts last-minute replication.
Last-minute replication is done in "one-shot" mode: replicates whatever data it has
and immediately stops without listening for changes in the local database.

name: replicate
description: Starts replication to a remote database.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} resolved when the replication connection succeeds for the first time.

return.description: resolved when the replication connection succeeds for the first time.

emits.description: state(state): the state of the replicator.

name: _ensureReplication
description: Restarts the replication process when unintentionally stopped.

name: _createReplicator
description:
Creates a new PouchDB replicator.
Remember that this class is simply a wrapper.

params.name: opts.live
params.description: Keep the replication running, pushing changes as they happen.

name: _updateState
description: Updates the Replicator's {@link Replicator#_state}.

params.name: moreLogData
params.description: Extra data to be included in the log.

name: src/icarus/classifier/index.js
Classifier
description:
Calculates packet and station scores.
Not an AI classifier.
Packet scores are calculated based on the CRC checksum(60%)
and simple heuristics(min/max value, variation between packets)(40%).
The heuristics used are configured in the packet-heuristics.js map.
Station scores are calculated based on the average packet score. The weight of
each packet score is determined by the racional function 1/2x where x is a
positive non-zero integer that represents how recent the packet is (1 being the
most recent packet).

name: constructor
description: Constructor.

name: stationScore
description: The station score.

name: _lastData
description:
The last data received (all packets merge in here).
Used for heuristic algorithms.

name: _log
description: Logger instance.

name: classifyPacket
description:
Classifies one packet and updates the station score (unless told otherwise).
Packet scores are calculated based on the CRC checksum(60%)
and simple heuristics(min/max value, variation between packets)(40%).

params.name: updateStationClassification
params.description: Whether to update the station score.

emits.description: stationScore(stationScore): when updateStationClassification is true, the station score is updated and the event is fired.

name: classifyStationInc
description:
Updates the station score(incrementally).
Station scores are calculated based on the average packet score. The weight of
each packet score is determined by the racional function 1/2x where x is a
positive non-zero integer that represents how recent the packet is (1 being the
most recent packet).

params.name: packetScore
params.description: The score of the previously unnacounted packet.

emits.description: stationScore(stationScore): because the station score was updated.

name: src/icarus/classifier/packet-heuristics.js
content:
/**
 * Heuristic creation helper.
 * Fails when value leaves a certain interval: [min, max].
 * @param {Number} min Minimum value.
 * @param {Number} max Maximum value.
 * @returns {Function} The heuristic function.
 * @private
 */
function minmaxH(min, max) {
	return val => val >= min && val <= max
}

/**
 * Heuristic creation helper.
 * Fails when a value jumps up or down a number greater than [variation].
 * @param {Number} variation Maximum variation between packets to be expected.
 * @returns {Function} The heuristic function.
 * @private
 */
function variationH(variation) {
	return (val, lastVal) => Math.abs(val - lastVal) <= variation
}

/**
 * The heuristic algorithms to be used in each field.
 * Format: [ [...fields], [...heuristics] ].
 */
export default new Map([
	[['counter', 'sentAt.millis'], [variationH(1)]],
	[['temp.0', 'temp.1'], [minmaxH(10, 37), variationH(10)]],
	[['press.0', 'press.1'], [minmaxH(0, 2000), variationH(100)]]
])

name: minmaxH
description:
Heuristic creation helper.
Fails when value leaves a certain interval: [min, max].

name: variationH
description:
Heuristic creation helper.
Fails when a value jumps up or down a number greater than [variation].

params.name: variation
params.description: Maximum variation between packets to be expected.

name: src/icarus/data-handler/cansat-strings.js
content:
/**
 * Array of CanSat strings: informational messages.
 * The CanSat does not store nor send strings. It just works
 * with small integers (uint8_t) and sends them in place.
 * In the ground station, these identifiers are used to retrieve the correct
 * string representation.
 *
 * These correspond to informational messages, sent in PACKET_INFO packets
 */
export const messages = [
	'Unknown message/error.',
	'No DS18B20 sensors found. [temperature]',
	'Only one DS18B20 sensor found. [temperature]'
]

/**
 * Array of CanSat strings: module names.
 * The CanSat does not store nor send strings. It just works
 * with small integers (uint8_t) and sends them in place.
 * In the ground station, these identifiers are used to retrieve the correct
 * string representation.
 *
 * These correspond to module names (as in ModuleRegistry modules), sent in PACKET_SETTINGS packets.
 */
export const moduleNames = [
	'Status LED',
	'Telemetry packet routine',
	'Temperature update',
	'Pressure update'
	// TODO: update
]

name: messages
description:
Array of CanSat strings: informational messages.
The CanSat does not store nor send strings. It just works
with small integers (uint8_t) and sends them in place.
In the ground station, these identifiers are used to retrieve the correct
string representation.

These correspond to informational messages, sent in PACKET_INFO packets

name: moduleNames
description:
Array of CanSat strings: module names.
The CanSat does not store nor send strings. It just works
with small integers (uint8_t) and sends them in place.
In the ground station, these identifiers are used to retrieve the correct
string representation.

These correspond to module names (as in ModuleRegistry modules), sent in PACKET_SETTINGS packets.

name: src/icarus/data-handler/index.js
tmBuffer
description:
'Transceiver MODE' Buffer for future comparison.
Helps ignoring messages from transceiver.

name: parser
description:
Creates and returns a "byteDelimiter" parser.
DISCLAIMER: It's a patched version of node-serialport's byteDelimiter parser.
You can find it's source here: https://github.com/EmergingTechnologyAdvisors/node-serialport/tree/master/lib/parsers.js
Changes from the original: trailing delimiters are removed, buffer passes through packetParser.parse before being emitted
and empty buffers and 'Transceiver MODE' messages are ignored.
Separates packets by a byte delimiter and passes them through {@link packetParser}

name: dataHandler
description:
A handler for incoming {@link Serial#data}.
Saves packets to the local database.
Should be called bound to a {@link Station}.

params.name: packet
params.description: Packet to be parsed and saved.

name: src/icarus/data-handler/parser.js
IcarusParser
description: The parser for Team Icarus' CanSat.

name: parse
description:
Implementation of {@link Parser#parse}.
Automatically decodes the quasi-binary packet with {@link decode}.
Supports telemetry, info and settings packets.
Also converts sensor values to standard units and attaches text representations
of module names and messages.

name: src/icarus/data-handler/unit-conv.js
getBit
description: Gets one bit out of a byte/bytes.

params.name: b
params.description: {Number} The byte or bytes (up to one 32bit unsigned integer).

name: DS18B20
description: Converts raw DS18B20 temperatures to C.

name: MPX4115A
description: Converts raw MPX4115A temperatures to hPa.

name: gpsFlags
description:
Processes the GPS boolean flags that are crammed in one byte.
In this order we have: latitude sign, longitude sign, location validity,
speed validity, course validity and altitude validity.

name: gpsCoordinate
description:
Convert raw coordinate object ({deg, billionths}) into an actual latitude
or longitude coordinate.
This does not check any sign/cardinal orientation. The coordinate is always
positive.

name: src/icarus/station.js
tMinusVid
description: T-Minus Transceiver Vendor ID

name: tMinusPid
description: T-Minus Transceiver Product ID

name: Station
description:
Handles everything a Station should.
Brings Serial, data parsing, database saving and the backend connection together.

name: constructor
description: Sets up all relevant class instances (Serial, parsers...) and events listeners.

name: name
description: Name/ID of the station

name: db
description: Database instance, internal to the station.

name: logDB
description: Log database instance, internal to the station.

name: _log
description: Logger instance.

name: serial
description: {@link Serial} instance with the {@link parser} attached.

name: classifier
description: {@link Classifier} instance.

name: backend
description: {@link Backend} connector instance.

name: getAvailablePorts
description:
Returns a list of available serialports and tries to find which ones
are the T-Minus transceiver (sets [portInfo].recommend to true) and sorts
them with recommended ones first.

name: cleanup
description:
Cleanup function to be run before exiting.
Closes the serialport and runs {@link Backend#cleanup}.

return.description: Promise that completes when all is clean.

name: src/index.js
src/lib/backoff-wrapper.js
ExponentialBackoff
description: A wrapper over the ExponentialBackoffStrategy from the backoff module.

name: constructor
description: Constructor.

name: _strategy
description: ExponentialBackoffStrategy instance.

name: _backoffNumber
description: Number of previous failed attempts.

name: _timeoutID
description: Backoff timeout ID.

name: backoff
description: Signals that we tried executing the protected routine and failed, or that we want to start the process.

emits.description: backoff(_backoffNumber, delay) delay is how much time will pass before we try executing the routine.

name: reset
description: Resets failed attempt number and cancels a possible pending action (routine execution after backoff).

name: success
description:
Used to signal the routine was successful.
This resets the wrapper.

name: src/lib/db.js
getDB
description: Gets a local database.

unknown.tagValue: {PouchDB} PouchDB instance referring to the requested database.

return.description: PouchDB instance referring to the requested database.

name: getRemoteDB
description:
Gets a remote database.
When provided a URL with no port, the default CouchDB ports for HTTP and HTTPS will be added automatically.

unknown.tagValue: {PouchDB} PouchDB instance referring to the requested database.

return.description: PouchDB instance referring to the requested database.

name: src/lib/log.js
createLogger
description:
Creates a configured bunyan logger.

Our log output configuration:
- Everything goes to stdout
- debug-level or more severe messages go to a rotating file
- info-level or more severe messages go to the database

When error-level or more severe messages are logged to the database,
they include an extra "context" property with the last 30 log messages
(of all levels).

params.name: db
params.description: Database where logs will be stored.

name: src/lib/pass-event.js
passEvent
description: Forwards an event from one EventEmitter to another.

params.name: destEmitter
params.description: EventEmitter to where the event will be forwarded.

params.name: sourceEvent
params.description: Event name to be listened to.

name: src/lib/path.js
pathPrefix
description:
A prefix for capture-lib files (DBs, logs).
Can be overriden via `global.pathPrefix` or `global.dbNamePrefix` (Deprecated).
It is used to store capture-lib files (like databases and logs)
in a specific directory that is not necessarily the current working directory.

name: src/parser.js
Parser
description:
Parser creation helper class. Any subclasses should reimplement the parse method,
calling super.parse in the beginning. You have useful methods for reading regular C
datatypes from the buffer: readInt, readFloat, readChar... To use it in node-serialport
or the serial wrapper just pass in ::Parser.parse
Keep in mind not initialize this class as is. RE-IMPLEMENT Parser.parse!

params.name: endianess
params.description: Set byte-order to big endian (BE) or little endian (LE).

name: _raw
description: Current packet being parsed.

name: _i
description: Current position in the packet being parsed.

name: packet
description: Parsed output container.

properties.name: crc.sent
properties.description: The CRC32 checkum sent along with the packet.

properties.name: crc.local
properties.description: The CRC32 checksum calculated from the sent data.

name: endianess
description:
Raw packet byte endianess (Little Endian (LE) for the Arduino).
Acceptable values: LE, BE.

name: parse
description:
Parses a packet. Default implementation resets state and calculates and extracts the CRC32
checksum before parsing the new packet.
That's why, if you want any parsing at all to be performed, YOU MUST RE-IMPLEMENT THIS METHOD.
Preferrably calling this implementation before any parsing(but after any decoding
*wink* *wink* quasi-binary decoder).

name: setValue
description:
The value setter called by read* helper functions.
Uses object path dot notation in the key and can convert values in one line.

params.name: key
params.description: The object path where the value will be inserted.

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: readInt
description: Reads a signed integer of 1-6 bytes.

params.name: key
params.description: The dot notation path where the int goes to.

params.name: size
params.description: The size in bytes of the integer (1 to 6 bytes only).

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: readUInt
description: Reads an unsigned integer of 1-6 bytes.

params.name: key
params.description: The dot notation path where the int goes to.

params.name: size
params.description: The size in bytes of the integer (1 to 6 bytes only).

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: readFloat
description: Reads a 32-bit float.

params.name: key
params.description: The dot notation path where the float goes to.

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: readChar
description: Reads a char.

params.name: key
params.description: The dot notation path where the char goes to.

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: readBoolean
description: Reads a boolean.

params.name: key
params.description: The dot notation path where the boolean goes to.

params.name: converter
params.description: A function that converts the value.

name: src/serial.js
Serial
description:
A node-serialport wrapper that keeps track of port state and allows from on-the-fly
port path/name changes (automatically attaches/detaches event listeners and keeps config).

name: constructor
description: Constructor: the place for setting the baud rate and parser.

name: _port
description: Holds the current node-serialport instance.

name: _baud
description: Holds the desired serial baud rate.

name: _parser
description: Holds the parsing function.

name: _path
description: Holds the current port path.

name: _state
description: Holds current state. Possible values: disconnect, open, close, disconnect_force.

name: _log
description: Logger instance. (Bunyan API).

name: setPath
description:
Sets a new path to all future serialport instances. If a port is already open,
it is automatically closed and a new one is opened with the new path (keeps event listeners).

return.description: When path is changed and the port recreated/reopened.

emits.description: data(packet): New data arrived (after being parsed by Serial#_parser).
error(error): An error ocurred in node-serialport.

name: open
description: Opens the serialport, creating it if needed.

return.description: Resolved when the serial port is open.

emits.description: data(packet): New data arrived (after being parsed by Serial#_parser).
error(error): An error ocurred in node-serialport.

name: close
description: Closes the serialport.

return.description: Resolved when the serialport is closed.

emits.description: error(error): An error ocurred in node-serialport.

name: _destroyPort
description: Destroys the current serialport instance. Removing all listeners and closing it beforehand.

name: _createPort
description:
Creates the serialport instance and attaches all relevant event listeners
that forward data and errors and keep track of state.

return.description: A resolved Promise for easy chaining in {@link Serial#setPath}.

emits.description: data(packet): New data arrived (after being parsed by Serial#_parser).
error(error): An error ocurred in node-serialport.

name: _updateState
description:
Shortcut for updating state that changes this._state and emits
a stateChange event with one call.

name: listPorts
description:
Lists available ports in the system with SerialPort.list.
Tries to fill out vendorId and productId fields in Windows from pnpId.
